content: HPPD (Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder) is a recognized medical condition in which an individual experiences visual distortions and hallucinations similar to those caused by hallucinogenic drugs, even though they are not currently under the influence of the drug. These symptoms can be distressing and can have a significant impact on an individual's daily life. The condition is considered to be rare, but it can occur in people who have a history of using hallucinogenic drugs.
